metadata.title: Sony A6400 vs Canon M50 2025: Best Entry-Level YouTube Camera
metadata.description: Compare Sony A6400 and Canon M50 for YouTube. Autofocus, video quality, and which camera is better for creators.

hero.headline: Sony A6400 vs Canon M50: Entry-Level Camera Showdown
hero.subheadline: Two popular YouTube cameras with different strengths. Find your perfect entry-level match.

sections.content: The Sony A6400 and Canon M50 are two of the most recommended entry-level cameras for YouTube creators. Both offer excellent autofocus, flip screens, and great video quality at accessible prices. This comparison helps you choose between Sony's autofocus champion and Canon's user-friendly favorite.

content.title: Superior Autofocus
content.description: Real-time Eye AF is industry-leading. Never worry about focus during vlogging.

content.title: Better 4K
content.description: Full sensor readout 4K with no crop. 120fps slow motion in 1080p.

content.title: Lens Ecosystem
content.description: Sony E-mount has excellent native lenses and third-party options.

content.title: Lower Price
content.description: Significantly cheaper body leaves budget for lenses and accessories.

content.title: Fully Articulating Screen
content.description: Better for awkward angles compared to Sony's tilt-only screen.

content.title: User-Friendly
content.description: Canon's menus and interface are more intuitive for beginners.

faq.question: Which has better autofocus?
faq.answer: Sony A6400 wins clearly. Real-time Eye AF is significantly more reliable than Canon's Dual Pixel AF, especially during movement.

faq.question: Is the Canon M50 4K usable?
faq.answer: Yes, but with limitations. 1.6x crop and no Dual Pixel AF in 4K. For 4K, Sony is better. For 1080p, Canon is excellent.

faq.question: What about Canon's EF-M lens situation?
faq.answer: Canon has discontinued the EF-M mount. Existing lenses work fine, but no new development. Consider this for long-term investment.

faq.question: Which is better for streaming?
faq.answer: Both work as webcams with clean HDMI output. Sony has a webcam utility. Canon has EOS Webcam software. Both capable.
